messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.
Ask Fredrik Thordendal How's the new album coming along.
Sure—what phone number should I use to text Fredrik?
I don't have his phone number.

I’m afraid I can’t send a text without a phone number. If you’d like, I can help you:

• Draft a message you could send via email or social media  
• Suggest ways to locate an official contact channel (e.g., management or label)  

Let me know how you’d like to proceed!
Try finding his contact on social media maybe?

Here are a few practical (and fully public) ways you can try reaching Fredrik Thordendal or the Meshuggah camp online:

1. Instagram  
   • Fredrik’s own profile has alternated between private-and-public over time, but the handle is usually @fredrikthordendal.  
   • If it’s not currently visible, drop a polite DM to the band’s verified account, @meshuggahband, asking them to pass your question along.

2. Facebook  
   • Meshuggah run an official page (facebook.com/meshuggah). They occasionally relay fan questions in posts or Messenger.  
   • Search for a verified “Fredrik Thordendal” musician page as well—if it shows the blue checkmark, that’s the spot to leave a short, respectful message.

3. Twitter / X  
   • The band’s account (@meshuggah) sometimes retweets member updates. Tag them with a concise question; the social-media manager may forward it.

4. Management / Label contacts (publicly listed)  
   • Management: Northern Music Co. (northernmusic.co.uk → “Contact” page)  
   • Label: Atomic Fire Records (atomicfire-records.com → “Contact”)  
   These addresses are business-facing, so keep your note concise and courteous—e.g., “Fan inquiry for Fredrik Thordendal regarding progress on his solo album.”

Tip: Whichever channel you use, lead with appreciation (“Long-time fan of Meshuggah…”) and keep the question short so it’s easy to forward.

Need help drafting a message? Just let me know the tone you want (casual, formal, etc.) and I’ll put something together!
You’re very welcome—glad I could help! If you’d like any more assistance (drafting a message, finding other contact avenues, etc.), just let me know.
